cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 miles ENE of the north-western Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn west-south-west on Tuesday, cross the north-western Bahamas Wednesday, then reach the central-east Florida coast Wednesday night before moving inland across Florida and curving northeastward over the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-east Florida coast (around the Volusia/Brevard County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach FL to north of Ocean Reef; Volusia/Brevard County line to Hallandale Beach under Hurricane Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northwest Bahamas under Hurricane Warning; Hallandale Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA under Tropical Storm Warning; North Palm Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA under Storm-Surge Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Bahamas, much of the Florida east coast, and portions of the Georgia–South Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (≤5%) chance of occasional tropical-storm-force gusts late this week; otherwise prevailing breezy conditions
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected — surge threat confined to the Florida and Georgia Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain possible Fri–Sat (<2 inches) as the remnant system passes well east
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rip-current risk along Alabama beaches may increase late week, but port waterways not expected to be significantly affected
